learningContent.title: Adding a properties table to a reference

lcInstruction.p: The <properties> element is used to present a series of properties pertaining to the current topic. It contains an optional <prophead> element, and then one or more <property elements.

step.cmd: Inside the <refbody> element, add a <properties> element and populate it with a <prophead> element.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Duck watching reference</title> <refbody> <properties> <prophead>
</prophead> </properties> </refbody> </reference>

step.cmd: Inside the <prophead> element, add a <proptypehd>, <propvaluehd>, and <propdeschd> element and add content to it as shown.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Duck watching reference</title> <refbody> <properties> <prophead> <proptypehd>Duck type</proptypehd> <propvaluehd>Species</propvaluehd> <propdeschd>Distinctive features</propdeschd> </prophead> </properties> </refbody> </reference>

info.p: While not all required, the elements added here must be in this specific order. If they are not, your document will not validate.

step.cmd: After the <prophead> element, add six <property> elements.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Duck watching reference</title> <refbody> <properties> <prophead> <proptypehd>Duck type</proptypehd> <propvaluehd>Species</propvaluehd> <propdeschd>Distinctive features</propdeschd> </prophead> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> </properties> </refbody> </reference>

step.cmd: Inside each <property> element, add a <proptype>, <propvalue>, and <propdesc> element and add content to it as shown.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Duck watching reference</title> <refbody> <properties> <prophead> <proptypehd>Duck type</proptypehd> <propvaluehd>Species</propvaluehd> <propdeschd>Distinctive features</propdeschd> </prophead> <property> <proptype>Dabbling</proptype> <propvalue>Gadwall</propvalue> <propdesc>Gray-brown in color, with a white belly and black rump</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Dabbling</proptype> <propvalue>Mallard</propvalue> <propdesc>Green head with white neck ring</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Diving</proptype> <propvalue>King Eider</propvalue> <propdesc>Orange bill sweeping up into a large shield outlined in black, pale blue crest</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Diving</proptype> <propvalue>Spectacled Eider</propvalue> <propdesc>Feathers extend down to nostrils, white patch around the eyes</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Whistling</proptype> <propvalue>West Indian Whistling Duck</propvalue> <propdesc>Black bill, long greenish legs that extend beyond the tail in flight</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Whistling</proptype> <propvalue>Fulvous Whistling Duck</propvalue> <propdesc>White "V" separating tail and back, very vocal</propdesc> </property> </properties> </refbody> </reference>
